Utterance: Hi! It’s wonderful to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing a bit better. I actually called my family last week.
That’s fantastic! How did that go?
It was really nice. We talked for a long time, and it felt good to reconnect.
I’m so glad to hear that! It sounds like that connection brought you some joy. How did it impact your mood afterward?
I felt more grounded, like I wasn’t so alone. It was comforting.
That’s wonderful progress. Have you been able to keep up with your painting as well?
Yes, I painted again! I did a piece inspired by our conversation about sunsets.
That’s amazing! It seems like you’re finding ways to express yourself creatively. How did that make you feel?
It felt liberating. I think I’m starting to enjoy the process more than worrying about the outcome.
That’s a significant shift! Embracing the process can be very therapeutic. Have you noticed any changes in your motivation or energy levels since incorporating these activities?
I think so. I still have my low days, but I feel like I have more tools to cope with them now.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI):Current Functional Status

Utterance: That’s a great insight. It’s important to recognize that progress isn’t always linear. Are there any particular coping strategies that have worked best for you?
The mindfulness exercises have been helpful. I’ve been trying to remember to practice them every morning.
That’s excellent! Consistency can really help solidify those habits. How do you feel when you practice mindfulness?
I feel more centered and ready to face the day. It helps clear my mind.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI):Current Functional Status

Utterance: I’m really proud of you for committing to that practice. Is there anything you’d like to explore further today?
I’ve been thinking about my job search again. I feel a bit overwhelmed at times.
It’s understandable to feel overwhelmed. Have you broken down your job search into smaller, manageable steps?
I haven’t really. I think I just look at the big picture and get stressed.
Let’s try breaking it down together. What are some small steps you could take this week?
Maybe I could spend some time updating my resume and applying to one or two jobs.
That sounds like a great plan! Setting small, achievable goals can help reduce that feeling of overwhelm.
I like that idea. I think I can handle that.
Fantastic! Let’s check in about how that goes in our next session. Remember to celebrate those small victories, no matter how minor they may seem.
I will. Thank you for the reminder.
You’re doing great work. I’m here to support you through this process. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
No, I think that covers it for now.
Alright! I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress next time. Take care of yourself.
Thanks, Ellie! See you next time!
Bye!
